item.title: YBA Codes in Roblox (November 2024)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/yba-codes-roblox/

Using Your Bizarre Adventure or YBA codes, you can claim multiple rewards for free such as arrows and Rokakaka. For November 2024, there are multiple active YBA codes available to enhance your in-game Roblox experience.

  • All active codes
  • How to redeem codes
  • All expired codes

All Active YBA Codes

Here are all the active codes you can redeem in Your Bizarre Adventure right now:

  • YOUR NEXT LINE: Redeem for 1x Lucky Arrow, 1 of 3 new Fighting Style items
  • LootBug: Redeem for Lucky Arrows
  • StickyArrows: Redeem for 20x Mysterious Arrows
  • StickyChristmasGift: Redeem for a Christmas Present
  • StickyAndFruity2: Redeem for 20x Rokakakas
  • YessirMy3VampMainsRiseUp: Redeem for 5x Rokakaka, 1x Pure Rokakaka, and 1x Mysterious Arrow.

Before you redeem all these items, make sure to reach Prestige Level 3+, or else you won’t be able to claim the rewards.

How To Redeem YBA Codes

To redeem codes in Your Bizarre Adventure, all you need to do is:

  1. Open up the game.
  2. After it loads up, click on Play.
  3. Click on the three horizontal lines from the bottom right corner of the screen.
  4. Then, click on Settings.
  5. Paste any code from the list above in the area provided and hit the Redeem Code button.

The process to redeem codes in YBA is straightforward and doesn’t require additional steps, unlike some other Roblox games out there.

All Expired YBA Codes

Below you can find the list of all expired codes in Your Bizarre Adventure:

  • weresoback
  • YBANUDONTDELAYANUPDATECHALLENGE
  • ybanu
  • helpme
  • eternal
  • sorry
  • SORRYFORGUTSQUESTBUG
  • MERRYCHRISTMAS
  • WOUREWORK
  • srryforblackscreen
  • YareYareDawa
  • YummersOneMillionLikes
  • HUGE
  • FreeStandSkin

We will be updating this page with more new codes once they are live. In the meantime, you can follow UzuKee on X for all the latest updates on the game.

Stay up to date with all the latest news and guides on Roblox games by signing up for Insider Gaming’s weekly newsletter.

item.title: Valorant Challengers Reveal 2025 Changes and More
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/valorant-challengers-reveal-2025-changes-and-more/

The 2025 season for Valorant Challengers is just around the corner, and in a recent press release, Riot Games unveiled some new changes and updates to the format and schedule for the APAC region. Here is everything we know as of now.

Academy Teams to Join Valorant Challengers in 2025

In its official press release, Riot Games expressed the desire to “deepen its development pipeline” and will implement Academy Teams into the Challengers Leagues across the APAC region (Asia-Pacific).

The goal is for this change to allow teams to scout for new talent beforehand, allowing them to test and develop their rosters. However, Riot Games made it exceptionally clear that they still want to give opportunities to new teams trying to join the VCT Pacific.

Academy Teams will be able to participate in Challengers, but they will not be able to qualify for Ascension Pacific.

Participating Teams

The following teams have opted to have Academy Teams in their regional leagues:

  • Challengers Korea – DRX, Gen.G, T1
  • Challengers Japan – Zeta Division, DFM
  • Challengers Southeast Asia – RRQ, Talon, Team Secret
  • Challengers South Asia – Global Esports

The partnered teams who opt-in will be given a direct slot in their Challengers League for 2025.

Riot Releases 2025 APAC Schedule

Riot Games has also revealed the 2025 APAC Calendar which includes three splits that will lead into Ascension.

Academy Teams will have the chance to play alongside their respective teams during these tournaments but will not be able to participate in Ascension.

More information about the upcoming 2025 schedule will be unveiled later on as we round the corner of the year. Will you be watching the 2025 VCT season?

For more Insider Gaming news, read about the upcoming VCT Game Changers Championship format.

item.title: The Day Before Developers Fntastic Want You To Design Levels For Them, But They Won’t Pay You
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-day-before-developers-fntastic-want-you-to-design-levels-wont-pay-you/

The developers behind the failed extraction shooter The Day Before are asking people to design levels for its next game. Fntastic took to its Discord server (h/t Eurogamer) to announce a “contest” for people to design a map for its latest attempt at a game, ITEMS.

The catch is, the winner of the contest won’t be paid for their work.

“This contest is a chance for you to unleash your creativity by designing a map that, if it wins, will be added to the game in future updates,” the announcement read.

Rules for participating in the “contest” were then laid out, which includes stating that submissions can be 2D drawings, 3D models, or “any other style”. In addition to the map design, submissions need to also include images and artwork, a full description, the map’s theme, layoff, and “balance considerations”.

The kicker, as mentioned earlier, is that the person who creates the winning submission won’t receive any payment for the time put into designing the map. Instead, they’ll simply get a copy of the game — if it ever releases –, the map built for use in the game, and their name displayed “somewhere” on the map.

As of publishing, six maps have been submitted.

Fntastic’s History With Fan Submissions

Fntastic looking for fan submissions for its map designs isn’t something new for the studio. During the development of The Day Before, the studio regularly used unpaid volunteers for the development of its game. Those volunteers were located in various countries, including Russia, Belarus, Ukraine, Finland, and more.

At one point, the studio claimed to be using over 100 full time volunteers.

What do you think of Fntastic holding a contest for maps for its new game? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what EA CEO Andrew Wilson had to say about the potential for an Apex Legends 2. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Free PlayStation Plus Games For November 2024 Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/free-playstation-plus-games-for-november-2024-announced/

Sony has announced its lineup of free games for PlayStation Plus members for November 2024. As usual, three games will be available for PlayStation Plus Essential subscribers and higher.

The three news games are Hot Wheels Unleashed 2 – Turbocharged, Ghostwire: Tokyo, and Death Note Killer Within. All three games will be available starting November 5.

They will be available until December 2.

Details on each game can be found below via Sony:

Hot Wheels Unleashed 2 – Turbocharged | PS4, PS5 

Race over 130 vehicles, including Hot Wheels Originals, Hot Wheels Monster Trucks, motorbikes and ATVs, each with their unique racing style, across multiple game modes and amazing environments. Upgrade vehicles with a dedicated skill tree that will directly affect their performance. Discover 5 brand new locations, master their secrets, and you’ll feel right at home both there and on the podium. Alternatively create the track of your dreams with the powerful Track Editor, or use the best creations from the community.

Ghostwire: Tokyo | PS5

Tokyo is overrun by deadly supernatural forces as a dangerous occultist causes the city’s population to vanish in an instant. Join forces with a powerful spectral entity on their quest for vengeance and master a powerful arsenal of abilities to unravel the dark truth behind the disappearance as you face the unknown in Ghostwire: Tokyo. 

Death Note Killer Within | PS4, PS5 

Death Note Killer Within is an online social deduction game for up to 10 players. Players will be split into two teams with different objectives. To win the game, players will need to figure out each other’s identities and either eliminate L who threatens Kira’s power or seize the Death Note. Enjoy a battle of wits as Kira and his followers, or as L and the investigators in the world of Death Note. As equally matched opponents, the two teams clash to control the game while hiding their true identities from each other. 

Like all monthly PlayStation Plus games, players can add them to their library to claim them at any time during the month they’re available. Once added, they can be installed and played at any time as long as you have an active membership.

Currently, PlayStation Plus members can get WWE 2K24, Dead Space, and Doki Doki Literature Club Plus! for their game library. Those games will be available until November 4.,

What do you think of the three free games coming to PlayStation Plus members in November 2024? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what EA CEO Andrew Wilson had to say about the potential for an Apex Legends 2. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Apex Legends 2 Not In EA’s Plans; Company To Continue “Innovating” Current Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/apex-legends-2-not-in-eas-plans-company-to-continue-innovating-current-game/

If you are hoping for EA to release Apex Legends 2, you might want to let go of that hope for now.

During its latest earnings call, EA CEO Andrew Wilson was asked about what the company’s plans were involving Apex Legends in order to regain a player base that has been steadily declining. One of those questions involved the possibility of doing a full rebuild of the game, and launching an Apex 2.0, of sorts.”

“[W]hat I would say is that typically, what we have seen — again in the context of live service driven games at scale is the Version 2 thing has almost never been as successful as the Version 1 thing,” Wilson said.

“And so actually, the objective right now is to ensure that we are continuing to support the global player base that we have and deliver the new innovative creative content on a season-by-season basis, as well as build these other things, but build them in a way that players do not have to give up the progress that they’ve made or the investment that they have put into the existing ecosystem.”

Wilson then went on to say that EA’s goal is to “innovate in the core experience” of Apex Legends. He said that it’s been seen as seasons move forward and continue to grow.

“[W]e’re changing kind of key modalities at play within those seasons and then build additional opportunities for engagement in different modalities of play beyond what the current core mechanic delivers,” he said. “And we think we can do those two things together, and we don’t believe we have to separate the experience in order to do so.”

Wilson also said that he, and the company, believe that Apex Legends is in an “incredibly good position” moving forward. Specifically, he mentioned the ability of the game to reach the “very top tier” of the genre while having a “strong brand”, “strong mechanic”, and a “very committed global community”.

Despite no plans for a completely new Apex Legends game, Wilson admitted that there is a need for changes to the game in order to keep that community happy and engaged with the game for months and years to come.

“We’ve also observed is a need for kind of meaningful systematic innovation in the game that fundamentally changes the way the game plays more broadly and our teams are working on that as well,” he said.

As far as what those innovations could be, that wasn’t mentioned. It was only reiterated that the “team is working through” it.

What do you hope to see from Apex Legends in the future if EA isn’t going to release Apex Legends 2? Let us know in the comments below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read the full details about Sony shutting down Concord developer Firewalk Studios. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
